paper.abstract: Models play a prominent role in reasoning about physical systems. Two problems in this context are constructing an initial model and revising a model depending on new data. Belief revision is a way to formalize the second process. This paper discusses the principles of belief revision and their application to reasoning in model-based systems for diagnosis and repair.
